Adult.description: Short-eared Owls are darker brown overall with more heavily streaked underparts than Barn Owls. They are often more active during the day than Barn Owls.

Adult female/immature male.description: Snowy Owls are larger and whiter than Barn Owls. Snowy Owls are active during the day and in most parts of North America are only seen during winter.

Adult.description: Burrowing Owls are smaller than Barn Owls with longer legs. They hunt on or near the ground during the day when Barn Owls are usually not active.
Long-eared Owls have an orange facial disc and long ear tufts while Barn Owls have a white facial disc and no ear tufts.
